title: Seville Cathedral
summary: The Cathedral of Saint Mary of the See (Spanish: Catedral de Santa María de la Sede),  better known as Seville Cathedral, is a Roman Catholic cathedral in Seville, Andalusia, Spain.[1] It was registered in 1987 by UNESCO as a World Heritage Site, along with the adjoining Alcázar palace complex and the General Archive of the Indies.[2] It is the fourth-largest church in the world (its size remains a matter of debate) as well as the largest Gothic church.[3]
